SpicyGirl

I have copyrights on my poems. But still want to share one with everyone. Here it gose....
 
 
 Fleeting
 
 Everything is fleeting. Trapped in a wrold thats not your own, smiling faces seem to vanish, and the tides of time rushes in. A heart once broken is mended, and tears that once brush a face, have been forgotten. In time, everything fades, pains that used to peirce, have lost their feeling. And laughter once heard, has faded away. All that is left is the memories one posses, and the feelings they envoke. Hold on the the things you love, never let them die, because with time you may forget them. Everything fades, only to leave, a whisper of what was once there.

post_info.post_title: Here Is My Poem! Wanna Hear It?!

Yossarian

Hmmm, yes, yes... I like poetry. Well not really; actually I hate most poetry, but I sense you're serious here. With that in mind (and figuring that you're open to feedback, else you wouldn't have posted):
 
 Fleeting
 
 Everything is fleeting.
 
 Trapped in a world that's not your own, 
 smiling faces seem to vanish
 and the Tide of Time rushes in.
 A heart once mended is broken, 
 and tears that once brushed a face
 have been forgotten.
 In Time everything fades;
 pains that used to pierce
 have lost their feeling.
 
 Laughter once heard has faded away.
 
 All that is left are 
 the memories one possesses,
 and the feelings they invoke.
 Hold fast to the things you love;
 never let them die because
 with Time you may forget them.
 
 Everything fades, only
 to leave a whisper of what once was there.
 
 
 *Sorry, but poetry is just as much visual to me as it is aural. I couldn't resist. And the English major in me just wouldn't let the spelling alone.*
 
 emoticon_xhoho
SpicyGirl

Thanks for the feedback, but this is not an english class. BTW, you taking the "s" off of the word tide, is not correct. In life you do not get hit with one tide. You get hit by several TIDES. So when I put the "s" at the end of tide. I knew what I was doing. So I have some advice for you. LEAVE MY POEM ALONE!! And go entertain yourself somewhere else, please.emoticon_rolleyes

I think it is pretty good prose, albeit with some grammatical and spelling problems, but if you make the decision to put your work before people, don't be surprised or offended by their feedback.

I think it is pretty good prose, albeit with some grammatical and spelling problems, but if you make the decision to put your work before people, don't be surprised or offended by their feedback.

 
 Okay, what is"prose" and "albeit"? And you're talking to me about spelling?! Is "prose" supposed to mean poem?! I'm not trying to be nasty, but come on now. Don't critize me now.
Coyote

prose - writing that has no obvious rhythm or rhyme scheme. In other words, not a poem. Most novels are written in prose. Stream of consciousness is usually prose.
 
 albeit - a three dollar word that means "but".
Collin

Okay, what is"prose" and "albeit"? And you're talking to me about spelling?! Is "prose" supposed to mean poem?! I'm not trying to be nasty, but come on now. Don't critize me now.

 
 No one's critisized you at all. You need to see the difference between helpful suggestions and flaming. In fact, it's best to not even defend critique in the first place. Only writers who are insecure with their abilities from the start feel the need to disprove constructive criticism.
Yossarian
